newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: ADB okays $300-mln loans for India infrastructure.
newsitem.headline: ADB okays $300-mln loans for India infrastructure.

text.p: The Manila-based Asian Development Bank (ADB) on Thursday approved $300 million in loans to three financial institutions in India for relending to private projects in power, telecommunications, roads and ports, the bank said.

An ADB news release said the bank would lend $150 million to the Industrial Credit and Investment Corp of India Ltd, $100 million to the Industrial Finance Corporation of India Ltd and $50 million to SCICI Ltd.
The loans were to encourage substantial private sector investment in infrastructure projects in the country, it said.
It said the loans were being provided under a private sector infrastructure facility established by the bank and guaranteed by India.

Each of the three participating financial institutions will be authorised to use a portion of its funds under the facility for capacity building, project preparation and implementation, the statement said.
